description: The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) has a requirement for an independent provider - Security Risk Management on an ‘as and when requested’ basis. The work is required for the Canadian Ombudsperson for Responsible Enterprise (the CORE or the Ombud). The CORE is an independent human rights ombud with a global mandate, who works at arms-length from DFATD. The CORE has an online complaint form through which individuals, communities, groups and those that represent them can submit complaints about possible human rights abuses resulting from the overseas operations of Canadian garment, mining and oil/gas companies.
full_summary:
### Security Risk Management Specialist Request for Proposal

Revised Posting Date | April 20, 2023
Solicitation Number | 23-225879A
Amendment Number | 1
**Deadline Reminder:** All Submissions Due by [Please see below]

The [Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD)](https://www.international.gc.ca/geothemes/themes_home-geothemes-home-fr.aspx) invites you to submit a proposal for an independent provider to deliver Security Risk Management services on an “as and when requested” basis. The contracting entity seeks a qualified service provider to support the [Canadian Ombudsperson for Responsible Enterprise (CORE)](https://www.canadaatlaw.org/the-canada-ombudsperson-rights-and-business), an independent human rights ombud with a global mandate.

**Tender Overview:**
The selected service provider will be required to conduct risk assessments and provide risk management recommendations for selected Canadian companies operating overseas in high-risk sectors. This will involve analyzing the risk profile, developing mitigation strategies, and monitoring compliance.

**Eligibility and Compensation:**
The selected provider will be responsible for delivering services to the CORE with high-quality output at competitive rates. Service providers must be eligible to participate in the bidding process and hold the necessary certifications and qualifications.

**Duration and Extensions:**
The expected contract duration is from July 3, 2023, to March 31, 2024. Extensions may be granted upon mutual agreement between the contracting entity and the selected service provider.

**Key Dates:**
- **Publication Date:** April 20, 2023
- **Tender Closing Date:** May 31, 2023, at 14:00 (Eastern Time)
- **Expected Contract Start Date:** July 3, 2023
- **Expected Contract End Date:** March 31, 2024

**Trade Agreement Eligibility:**
Service providers can refer to the solicitation notice for a list of relevant trade agreements (list provided supports references) to which the contracting entity is committed.

**How to Respond:**
Interested service providers can obtain the RFP package by clicking on the provided links. Please ensure to review the terms and conditions and provide the required documents as per the specifications outlined in the solicitation notice.
